description: End users may experience a complete denial of service on systems utilizing Windows Hyper-V due to a critical issue described in the vulnerability (CVE-2024-21408). This results in the inability to access Hyper-V resources, which could lead to significant downtime for virtual machines. The issue affects multiple build versions, including Windows 10 (various versions), and Windows Server from 2016 to 2022. Users may see systems becoming unresponsive, or they could intermittently fail to start virtual machines. The security update referenced by several KB articles (KB-5035858, KB-5035854, KB-5035853, KB-5035845) is essential for ensuring operational continuity and preventing service interruptions.
